intro: Pentacalia guerrerensis, commonly known as the Guerrero pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and related genera. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
